tooltips.text: Total cost = procurement + buffer holding. Lower is better, but watch emissions and reliability.
Total CO₂ from selected suppliers. Cheaper suppliers often emit more. Buffers don't affect emissions directly.
Average supplier reliability. Higher = fewer disruptions. Buffers boost this by 2.5% each.
Average lead time across suppliers. Each buffer cuts this by ~1.2 days but adds $3,500 holding cost.
Buffers decouple variability: they reduce lead time and boost reliability, but increase holding cost.
Composite score: 40% cost efficiency, 40% emissions reduction, 20% reliability. Target 700+ for 4 stars.
Each supplier offers a trade-off. Low cost often means high emissions or low reliability. Choose three.
Three suppliers balance diversification and simplicity. Real supply chains use multi-sourcing for resilience.
Each scenario has different target thresholds and supplier pools. Test your optimization strategy across all three.
★★★★★ = Expert (850+), ★★★★ = Proficient (700+), ★★★ = Competent (550+), ★★ = Developing (400+), ★ = Needs work.

popups.title: First Improvement
popups.short: Nice move. Your latest selection improves the overall optimization score.
popups.long: Your changes reduced total cost or emissions while maintaining balance. Keep experimenting with supplier combinations and buffer placements to push your score higher.

popups.trigger: Cost and emissions both under scenario targets
popups.title: Target Reached
popups.short: You met both the cost and emissions targets. Try to improve reliability next.
popups.long: Congratulations -you've hit the cost and emissions thresholds for this scenario. Now see if you can boost reliability above 80% without breaking your targets. Buffers help.

popups.title: Trade-off Warning
popups.short: Costs went down, but emissions increased. Consider a greener supplier or add a buffer.
popups.long: You've reduced costs, but at the expense of higher emissions. This is a classic supply chain trade-off. Try swapping in a mid-range supplier or using buffers to decouple lead time without sacrificing green performance.

popups.trigger: User tries to select a 4th supplier
popups.title: Selection Limit
popups.short: You can only select three suppliers at once. Remove one to add another.
popups.long: The game constrains you to three suppliers to simulate multi-sourcing with manageable complexity. Deselect a current supplier before adding a new one.

popups.title: DDMRP Buffer Added
popups.short: Buffers decouple upstream variability. They reduce lead time and boost reliability, but add holding cost.
popups.long: You've positioned a DDMRP buffer. Buffers absorb demand and supply variability, cutting effective lead time by ~1.2 days and improving reliability by 2.5%. Each buffer costs $3,500/period in holding expense. Use them strategically.

popups.title: Emissions Alert
popups.short: Your emissions are 30% above target. Swap in lower-emission suppliers to hit your green goals.
popups.long: Current emissions are significantly above the scenario threshold. Look for suppliers with <10 kg CO₂ per unit. Yes, they cost more -but that's the optimization challenge. Buffers won't fix emissions; supplier choice will.

popups.title: Reliability Risk
popups.short: Your network reliability is below 65%. Add buffers or choose more reliable suppliers to reduce disruption risk.
popups.long: Low reliability increases the chance of supply disruptions. Either select suppliers with reliability scores above 75%, or position buffers to absorb variability. A balanced network targets 75%+ reliability.

popups.trigger: Score > 800 and all metrics in green zone
popups.title: Optimal Balance Achieved
popups.short: Excellent work. You've balanced cost, emissions, and reliability at a high level. This is expert-level optimization.
popups.long: You've achieved a rare trifecta: low cost, low emissions, and high reliability. Your supply chain is resilient, sustainable, and cost-effective. This level of performance is what real supply chain managers aim for.

end_summaries.title: Expert Optimizer
end_summaries.summary: Outstanding performance. You balanced cost, emissions, and reliability with precision. Your supplier choices and buffer placements reflect advanced supply chain thinking. In a real organization, this plan would earn executive approval and deliver sustainable competitive advantage.

end_summaries.title: Competent Performance
end_summaries.summary: Solid work. You understood the core trade-offs and made reasonable decisions. There's room to improve -experiment with different supplier combinations and consider adding buffers to reduce lead time. A few more iterations could push you into expert territory.

end_summaries.title: Needs Refinement
end_summaries.summary: Your plan has gaps. Either costs are too high, emissions are excessive, or reliability is too low. Review each supplier's attributes carefully. Remember: cheap suppliers often emit more; buffers improve reliability but cost money. Try again with a focus on balance.
